content.description:
Follow the black crack using the tree until you can traverse left into a horizontal finger-size crack. Follow this to its end, then go up to a wide hand crack which ends at a slab. Move up and slightly left onto slab, and look for bolt over your head (don't clip the lower bolt on

Journeyman

). Clip 2 more bolts until dbl bolt anchor on

Journeyman

.
content.location:
This is about 50' right of obvious, overhanging crack called

Journeyman

, behind a tree sitting on a ledge is a black crack.

climbs.name: Journeyman
climbs.fa: Bernard Gillett, Bob Jasperson, and Eric Roslanansky

content.description: Clip two bolts at the start and pull into crack, and struggle past bulges to the top of the overhang where the crack widens to #4 or large size just below a ledge and 2 bolt anchor. From ledge, follow a finger crack to another stance and the beginning of a 11c slab finish with 4 bolts to 2 bolt anchor. Rap the route.
content.protection: Several hand-size pieces for the initial crack, finger-size for the middle section crack, and 6 bolts, 2 at start and 4 at end. Bring tape or mitts.
content.location: In the center of the crag is a striking overhanging crack that beckons the climber.

content.description:
Climb the left side of a chockstone until your are on top of it, clip a bolt, then lieback a crack shooting a leg out to other wall when necessary, and follow the crack to belay on

Journeyman

.

The second pitch enters a nice, flaring crack on your left. There is nice heel-toe climbing if the size fits.
content.protection: SR + 2 bolts, bring several hand-size pieces for second pitch and a small cam.
content.location:
30' left of the

Journeyman

crack is the wide chimney with a chockstone 25' up.

content.description: Climb the crack in the corner until below an overhang, and gain the ledge using a stem. Diagonal right climbing knobs, chicken-heads, and cracks on ramps to the top.
content.location:
50' up the ramp to the left of

Box Chimney

is this corner.

pathTokens: South Fork of St. Vrain Canyon
